content: Since the start of the one and done era, you’ve got two national champions — Kentucky in 2012 and Duke in 2015 — that leaned heavily on one and done talent to win their titles. Duke’s 2010 bunch was (if my Tar Heel biased memory is accurate) junior and senior heavy between Kyle Singler-John Scheyer-Greg Holy Shit I Can’t Believe Your Goon Ass Became a Real Player Zoubek. I guess the question is whether chasing the one and dones is a better approach than building with experience? Granted, Duke and KY and maybe UCLA are the only teams that *can* recruit the way they do right now, and that’s 3 squads against a very large field on a year to year basis, but still. Overall the scale seems to tilt toward veteran teams being the way to go.
